title: Quick & Dirty way to get rough eStmt traffic statistics
body:   1. Obtain the raw log of all requests from all production IIS servers. Examples:  

    
        \\dell-2100\share\Ben Chan\ProdServerLogs

  2. Place them into single folder for easier calculation, also make it accessible by the standard Unix system commands (either native unix machine or cygwin)
  3. To get Daily counts:  

    
        egrep -v "GET /(msm/)?(images|favicon.ico|javascript|styles|scripts|crossdomain.xml|robots.txt)" *.log | egrep -v "\.(css|js|png|pdf|php) " | awk -F"[:| ]" '{print $3}' | sort | uniq -c

  
Output:  

    
         135588 2012-11-01
     175083 2012-11-02
     127213 2012-11-03
      91471 2012-11-04
     164241 2012-11-05
     154627 2012-11-06
     144638 2012-11-07
     141703 2012-11-08
     141755 2012-11-09
      95486 2012-11-10
      67759 2012-11-11
     101219 2012-11-12
     129071 2012-11-13
     130673 2012-11-14
     131755 2012-11-15
     131106 2012-11-16
      98544 2012-11-17
      75536 2012-11-18
     124532 2012-11-19
     130910 2012-11-20
     122239 2012-11-21
      66589 2012-11-22
      93203 2012-11-23
      88547 2012-11-24
      80714 2012-11-25
     128436 2012-11-26
     208579 2012-11-27
     311017 2012-11-28
     129526 2012-11-29
     229183 2012-11-30

  4. To get Hourly counts:  

    
        egrep -v "GET /(msm/)?(images|favicon.ico|javascript|styles|scripts|crossdomain.xml|robots.txt)" *.log | egrep -v "\.(css|js|png|pdf|php) " | awk -F"[:| ]" '{print $3 " " $4}' |sort |uniq -c

  
Output:  

    
           5904 2012-11-01 00
       4020 2012-11-01 01
       3815 2012-11-01 02
       3815 2012-11-01 03
       3102 2012-11-01 04
